Kanshudo_mnemonic: bones (骨) are plentiful (豊) in the body
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T works out his body (body-building), using two piles of books (i.e. an exercise that can be done at home with two chairs, similar to push-ups but working mostly the shoulders, trapezius and triceps).
humanum_full_description_en:
The original meaning of " body " is body. " Body " word out overnight, inscriptions found in the early Warring States Zhongshan Wang Fang pot, writing from the " body " "of Ti " word; bamboo and silk text is usually written from the " meat " of " 𦡊 "; today the passage from the " bone " From the " body " of "豊", only "Mawangdui. Seen in Fifty-two Sick Recipes. See "豊".

"Shu Wen": "Body, total twelve genera. From the bones, the sound", the so-called "total twelve genera" refers to the total number of people's head, body, hands, and feet divided into three. Duan Yucai's "Shuowen Jiezi Zhu" explained in detail: "The first genera has three: yiding, nian, and yi; the body is three: shoulder, ridge, and sing (one for 𡱂); The genus of the three is the arm, the arm and the hand; the genus of the foot is the thigh, the shin, and the foot."
humanum_short_description_en: Xiaozhuan's " body " starts from " bone " and "豊" sound, the original meaning is body.
humanum_full_description:
「體」的本義是身體。「體」字晩出，戰國早期金文見於中山王方壺，寫作從「身」的「軆」字；簡帛文字中通常寫作從「肉」的「𦡊」；今日通行的從「骨」從「豊」的「體」字僅《馬王堆．五十二病方》中得見。參見「豊」。

　　《說文》：「體，總十二屬也。从骨，豊聲」，所謂「總十二屬」是指人的頭、身、手、足各再分為三而得的總數。這一點段玉裁《說文解字注》有詳細解釋：「首之屬有三：曰頂、曰面、曰頤；身之屬三：曰肩、曰脊、曰尻(一作𡱂)；手之屬三：曰厷曰臂、曰手；足之屬三：曰股、曰脛、曰足。」
humanum_short_description: 小篆「體」從「骨」，「豊」聲，本義是身體。

ti3
HSK 2: 体,體
(Simplified: 体)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 豊 indicates the sound; 骨 (bone) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 骨 [ gǔ ] bone; skeleton; frame, framework
    • 豊 [ lǐ ] abundant, lush, bountiful, plenty
①人、動物的全身：身體。體重。體溫。體質。體徵(醫生在檢查病人時所發現的異常變化)。體能。體貌。體魄(體格和精力)。體育。體無完膚。
②身體的一部分：四體。五體投地。
③事物的本身或全部：物體。主體。羣體。
④物質存在的狀態或形狀：固體。液體。體積。
⑤文章或書法的樣式、風格：體裁(文學作品的表現形式，可分爲詩歌，散文，小說，戲劇等)。文體(文章的體裁，如“騷體”、“駢體”、“舊體詩”)。字體。
⑥事物的格局、規矩：體系。體制。
⑦親身經驗、領悟：體知(親自查知)。體味。身體力行(xíng)。
⑧設身處地爲人着想：體諒。體貼。體恤。
⑨與“用”相對。“體”與“用”是中國古典哲學的一對範疇，指“本體”和“作用”。一般認爲“體”是最根本的、內在的；“用”是“體”的外在表現。
體現 [ tǐ xiàn ]: to embody; to reflect; to incarnate
體系 [ tǐ xì ]: system; setup; Classifiers: 个

Meaning: body
Hanzi: 体
Story: Mr. T works out his body (body-building), using two piles of books (i.e. an exercise that can be done at home with two chairs, similar to push-ups but working mostly the shoulders, trapezius and triceps).
Kind: traditional

「 體 」的本義是身體。「 體 」字晩出，戰國早期金文見於中山王方壺，寫作從「 身 」的「 軆 」字；簡帛文字中通常寫作從「 肉 」的「 𦡊 」；今日通行的從「 骨 」從「 豊 」的「 體 」字僅《馬王堆．五十二病方》中得見。參見「 豊 」。 《說文》：「體，總十二屬也。从骨，豊聲」，所謂「總十二屬」是指人的頭、身、手、足各再分為三而得的總數。這一點段玉裁《說文解字注》有詳細解釋：「首之屬有三：曰頂、曰面、曰頤；身之屬三：曰肩、曰脊、曰尻(一作𡱂)；手之屬三：曰厷曰臂、曰手；足之屬三：曰股、曰脛、曰足。」
The original meaning of " body" is body. " Body" word out overnight, inscriptions found in the early Warring States Zhongshan Wang Fang pot, writing from the " body" "of Ti" word; bamboo and silk text is usually written from the " meat" of " 𦡊"; today the passage from the " bone" From the " body" of " 豊", only "Mawangdui. Seen in Fifty-two Sick Recipes. See " 豊". "Shu Wen": "Body, total twelve genera. From the bones, the sound", the so-called "total twelve genera" refers to the total number of people's head, body, hands, and feet divided into three. Duan Yucai's "Shuowen Jiezi Zhu" explained in detail: "The first genera has three: yiding, nian, and yi; the body is three: shoulder, ridge, and sing (one for 𡱂); The genus of the three is the arm, the arm and the hand; the genus of the foot is the thigh, the shin, and the foot."

體字的基本解释

體
tǐ

體
tī
均见“体”。

體字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tǐ］
［《廣韻》他禮切，上薺，透。］
“体2”的繁体字。亦作“躰1”。亦作“軆1”。亦作“骵1”。
(1)身体。
(2)指身体的一部分。
(3)肢体。特指手足。
(4)指古代用于祭祀或宴飨的牛羊猪的躯体或其切块。
(5)指草木的茎干。
(6)形体；物体。
(7)谓生长成形。
(8)形势。
(9)指字体；字的形状结构。
(10)指体裁；诗文的风格。
(11)兆象；卦象。《书·金縢》：“公曰：'體，王其罔害。'”孔传：“如此兆體，王其無害。”《诗·卫风·氓》：“爾卜爾筮，體無咎言。”毛传：“體，兆卦之體。”一说为虚词。俞越曰：“體字以一言爲句，乃發語之辭，慶幸之意也。”见《群经平议·尚书三》。
(12)整体；总体。
(13)部分。
(14)谓区分；分别开来。
(15)事物的主要部分；主体。
(16)指内容。
(17)心田；心神。
(18)指心胸。
(19)禀性；德性。
(20)承宗继祖的系统；血统。
(21)体统；体制。
(22)泛指言行

體字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【骨字部】　體； 康熙笔画：23； 页码：页1451第06
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【正韻】他禮切【集韻】【韻會】土禮切，?涕上聲。【說文】總十二屬也。【釋名】體，第也。骨肉毛血表裏大小相次第也。【廣韻】四支也。【禮·中庸】動乎四體。　又【易·文言】君子體仁，足以長人。【疏】體包仁道。　又【書·畢命】辭尚體要。【註】辭以理實爲要。　又【詩·衞風】爾卜爾筮，體無咎言。【傳】體，兆卦之體。　又【詩·大雅】方苞方體，維葉泥泥。【箋】體，成形也。　又【周禮·天官】體國經野。【註】體，猶分也。　又【周禮·天官·內饔】辨體名肉物。【註】體名，脊脅臂臑之屬。　又【禮·文王世子】外朝以官體異姓也。【註】體，猶連結也。　又【禮·學記】就賢體遠。【註】體，猶親也。　又【禮·中庸】體物而不可遺。【註】猶生也。　又【禮·中庸】體羣臣也。【註】猶接納也。　又【左傳·昭二十年】聲亦如味，一氣二體。【疏】樂之動身體者，唯有舞耳。舞者有文武二體。　【廣韻】俗作軆。【集韻】作躰。【增韻】俗作体，非。

體字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
體字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
body
tǐ
body

body
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tǐ］
["Guangyun" He is courteous and cut, topped with water chestnuts, and thoroughly. ]
Traditional characters of "体2". Also known as "躰1". Also known as "軆1". Also known as "骵1".
(1) Body.
(2) Refers to a part of the body.
(3) Limbs. Especially refers to siblings.
(4) Refers to the body of cattle, sheep and pigs used for sacrifices or feasts in ancient times or their cuts.
(5) Refers to the stems of plants and trees.
(6) Body; object.
(7) It is called growth and formation.
(8) Situation.
(9) Refers to the font; the shape and structure of the word.
(10) Refers to genre; the style of poetry.
(11) Zhaoxiang; Guaxiang. "Shu Jinxiu": "The public said:'The body is harmed by Wang Qi's.'" Kong Chuan: "Such a sign of the body, Wang Qi is harmless." "Poetry·Weifeng·Mang": "Erbul's No blame." Mao Chuan: "The body, the body of the hexagram." It is a function word. Yu Yue said: "The style of the word is a sentence, which is the speech of speech, and the meaning of rejoicing." See "Qunjing Pingyi · Shangshu III".
(12) Overall; overall.
(13) Part.
(14) What is called distinction; separate.
(15) The main part of things; the main body.
(16) Refers to content.
(17) Heart field; mind.
(18) Refers to the heart and mind.
(19) Disposition; Virtue.
(20) The system of inheriting the ancestors; descent.
(21) System; System.
(22) Generally refers to words and deeds
body
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Haiji 1】【Bone Character Department】　体; Kangxi Strokes: 23; Page Number: Page 1451 Page 06
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun] He is courteous and cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme will be] native courteous and cut,? [Said the text] The total twelve genera are also. 【Release name】The body, the first. The size of the bones, flesh and blood is in the same order. [Guang Yun] Four branches. 【Rite·Medium】Move all four bodies.　[Yi · Classical Chinese] A gentleman is physically benevolent, enough to grow up. 【Sparse】The body embraces benevolence.　[Book·Life] The words are still in style. [Note] The essentials of diction are based on reason and reality.　[Poetry·Weifeng] Erbu Erzhen, body without blame. 【Biography】The body, the body of the hexagram.　[Poetry·Daya] Fangbao cube, Weiye mud. 【Jian】The body is shaped.　[Zhou Li·Tianguan] The body of the country and the field. [Note] The body is still divided.　[Zhou Li·Tian Guan·Nei饔】Distinguish body names and meats. [Note] Body name, the genus of the spine-flank arm-snake.　[Li·Wen Wang Shizi] Foreign dynasties have different surnames. [Note] The body is still connected.　[Rite·Xue Ji] is a virtuous body far away. [Note] The body is still close to each other.　[Li·Meaning] The body is indispensable. [Note] Still alive.　[Rite·Medium] The body and the ministers are also. [Note] Still accept it.　[Zuo Zhuan·20 Years of Zhao] The sound is like a taste, one gas and two bodies. [Sparse] Music that moves the body, only dancing ears. The dancers have both civil and martial arts.　[Guangyun] Vulgarly written. 【Ji Yun】make 躰. [Added rhyme] Vulgar style, non.
